intro: Hiraea chlorocarpa, commonly known as the green-stemmed hiraea, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically ovate to elliptic in shape. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia, which are typical of the spurge family. Its leaves are usually green with a smooth surface and may have a slight pubescence. Hiraea chlorocarpa is often found in moist, shaded environments in tropical and subtropical regions.
